column1: This table details the codebook for the 2021 Canadian Election Study (CES 2021), and has been formatted into clear a type-name-description structure, organized by variable type.Aggregate, Calculated, and Data Quality Measures

column2: Variable Name(s)
column3: Description

column2: cps21_weight_general_all
column3: Weight for all Campaign Period Survey (CPS) respondents.

column2: cps21_weight_general_restricted
column3: Weight for high-quality CPS respondents (excluding those flagged for removal).

column2: pes21_weight_general_all
column3: Weight for all Post-Election Survey (PES) respondents.

column2: pes21_weight_general_restricted
column3: Weight for high-quality PES respondents.

column2: cps21_age
column3: Respondent age in years, calculated from cps21_yob (Year of Birth).

column2: cps21_time and pes21_time
column3: How long the respondent spent in the survey (CPS or PES, respectively), measured in minutes and calculated from Duration__in_seconds_.

column2: Region
column3: Sorts cps21_province into five defined regions: Atlantic, Ontario, Quebec, Territories, and West.

column2: cps21_data_quality_overall
column3: Categorical measure flagging the most important reason for removal (or "Clean complete") for CPS responses (e.g., Ineligible, Speeder, Duplicate).

column2: pes21_data_quality_overall
column3: Categorical measure flagging data quality for PES responses (e.g., Valid complete, PES speeder, Inattentive).

column2: pes21_friendsnames_1_valid, pes21_friendsnames_2_valid, pes21_friendsnames_3_valid
column3: Validity flags (1 for "Valid," 2 for "Not valid") based on respondent's text entry for names of people they talk about politics with.

column1: -----Core Survey Questions: Campaign Period Survey (CPS) Variables

column2: Key Variables (Examples)
column3: Variable Descriptions

column2: cps21_citizenship, cps21_yob, cps21_genderid, cps21_trans, cps21_province, cps21_education, cps21_employment, cps21_union, cps21_children, cps21_marital, cps21_household
column3: Citizenship status, year of birth, gender identity, province of residence, education level, employment status, union membership, household characteristics.

column2: cps21_bornin_canada, cps21_imm_year, cps21_immig_status, cps21_origin_1 to cps21_origin_5, cps21_vismin_1 to cps21_vismin_12
column3: Whether born in Canada, year of immigration, immigration category, ethnic/cultural origins (up to 5 text fields), identification with visible minority groups.

column2: cps21_interest_gen_1, cps21_interest_elxn_1, cps21_demsat, cps21_fed_gov_sat, cps21_prov_gov_sat, cps21_govt_confusing, cps21_govt_say
column3: Interest in politics generally/election (0-10 slider), satisfaction with democracy/federal/provincial government performance, feelings about government complexity and representation.

column2: cps21_imp_iss, cps21_imp_iss_party, cps21_imp_loc_iss, cps21_camp_issue
column3: Most important federal issue (text field) and best party to address it; most important local issue (text field); issue focused on most by campaign (text field).

column2: cps21_party_rating_23 to cps21_party_rating_29, cps21_lead_rating_23 to cps21_lead_rating_29, cps21_cand_rating_23 to cps21_cand_rating_27
column3: Affective ratings for federal parties, federal leaders, and local candidates (all 0-100 sliders).

column2: cps21_lr_parties_1 to cps21_lr_parties_7, cps21_lr_scale_bef_1, cps21_lead_int, cps21_lead_strong, cps21_lead_trust, cps21_lead_cares
column3: Placement of parties and self on left-right scale (0-10); perception of leaders' intelligence, strength, trustworthiness, and caring (select all that apply).

column2: cps21_v_likely, cps21_votechoice, cps21_2nd_choice, cps21_not_vote_for, cps21_not_vote_for_w, cps21_turnout_2019, cps21_vote_2019
column3: Likelihood of voting, intended vote choice, second choice, parties respondent would not vote for (and why), and reported 2019 turnout and vote choice.

column2: cps21_howvote1, cps21_howvote2, cps21_howvote3, cps21_comfort1, cps21_comfort2, cps21_comfort3
column3: Most likely/actual method of voting (e.g., in person, mail); comfort level voting in person during the COVID-19 pandemic.

column2: cps21_spend_educ, cps21_spend_env, cps21_spend_defence, cps21_spend_afford_h, cps21_spend_nation_c, etc.
column3: Attitudes on federal spending levels (less/same/more) across various domains (education, environment, defence, housing, childcare, etc.).

column2: cps21_pos_mailtrust, cps21_pos_fptp, cps21_pos_carbon, cps21_pos_jobs, cps21_covid_liberty, etc.
column3: Agreement/disagreement on various political and social issues (e.g., trustworthiness of mail voting, electoral system change, carbon tax, jobs vs. environment, COVID restrictions vs. liberty).

column2: cps21_econ_retro, cps21_econ_fed_bette, cps21_own_fin_retro, cps21_ownfinanc_fed, cps21_own_fin_future
column3: Retrospective evaluation of Canada's economy and personal finances, and future outlook; effect of federal policies on economy/personal finances.

column2: cps21_premier_name, cps21_finmin_name, cps21_govgen_name
column3: Multiple-choice questions testing recall of provincial Premier, federal Minister of Finance, and Governor-General.

column2: cps21_fed_id, cps21_fed_id_str, cps21_prov_id, cps21_prov_id_str
column3: Federal and provincial political party identification and strength of identification.

column2: cps21_groupdiscrim_1 to cps21_groupdiscrim_8, cps21_groups_therm_1 to cps21_groups_therm_7, cps21_imm, cps21_refugees
column3: Perceived level of discrimination against various groups; affective ratings (0-100 sliders) toward groups (e.g., immigrants, racial minorities, Indigenous peoples); attitudes on immigrant/refugee admission levels.

column2: Key Variables (Examples)
column3: Variable Descriptions

column2: pes21_turnout2021, pes21_notvotereason1, pes21_howvote, pes21_votechoice2021, pes21_resason_chose, pes21_when_decide, pes21_pr_votechoice
column3: Actual turnout in the 2021 federal election, main reason for not voting, method of voting, party voted for, most important reason for choosing that party, and timing of vote decision.

column2: pes21_votingsafe, pes_maileasy, pes_maildifficult, pes21_emb_satif, pes21_emb8, pes21_embsatisfy, pes21_emb4_1 to pes21_emb4_16
column3: Safety felt voting in person, difficulty/ease of mail-in voting, satisfaction/fairness with Elections Canada, overall satisfaction with voting experience, and sources of voting information.

column2: pes21_dem_sat, pes21_campatt, pes21_where_info, pes21_contact1, pes21_formgovt, pes21_keepromises
column3: Satisfaction with democracy, campaign attention, main source of campaign information, whether contacted by a party, preference for seats vs. votes in government formation, and belief in parties keeping promises.

column2: pes21_friendsnames_1 to pes21_friendsnames_3, pes21_friendswho_1_1 to pes21_friendswho_5_3, pes21_discfam, pes21_partic1 to pes21_partic3 (12 variables total), pes21_partymember
column3: Names of people discussed politics with (text fields), characteristics of those individuals, frequency of discussing politics with family/friends, detailed political participation activities, and party membership status.

column2: pes21_famvalues, pes21_bilingualism, pes21_equalrights, pes21_tieus, pes21_tiechina, pes21_ethid, pes21_can_id, pes21_populism_2 to pes21_populism_8
column3: Traditional family values, bilingualism/equal rights overreach, desired ties with US/China, importance of being Canadian/ethnicity/language to identity, perceived criteria for being "truly Canadian," and various measures of populist attitudes.

column2: pes21_paymed, pes21_senate, pes21_hatespeech, pes21_govtprograms, pes21_conf_inst1_1 to pes21_conf_inst2_6, pes21_foreign
column3: Support for paying for faster medical care, abolishing the Senate, banning hate speech, perception of government program effectiveness, confidence ratings in 10 political and social institutions, and confidence in safety from foreign interference in elections.

column2: pes21_donerm, pes21_donew, pes21_donegl, pes21_doneqc, pes21_inequal, pes21_gap
column3: Opinions on how much should be done for various groups (racial minorities, women, gays/lesbians, Quebec); belief that income inequality is a big problem; and support for reducing the gap between rich and poor.

column2: pes21_feminine_1, pes21_masculine_1, pes21_big5_1 to pes21_big5_10, pes21_health, pes21_phealth, pes21_mhealth
column3: Self-identification as feminine/masculine (0-100 sliders); Big Five personality trait descriptions (1-7 scale); and self-assessment of general, physical, and mental health.

column2: pes21_service_freq, pes21_parents_born, pes21_rural_urban, pes21_lived, pes21_follow_pol, pes21_lang, pes21_occ_text, pes21_occ_cat
column3: Frequency of religious services, parents' birth outside Canada, type of residence (rural/urban), years lived in community, closeness of following politics, language usually spoken at home, and occupation information.
